TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TraceOptions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies trace data options to be written to the trace output.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by trace listeners to determine which options, or elements, should be included in the trace output. Trace listeners store the trace options in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceListener.TraceOutputOptions%2A> property.
The following example shows the use of the `traceOutputOptions` attribute to specify the trace output options for a <xref:System.Diagnostics.ConsoleTraceListener> that is enabled using a configuration file.
``` <configuration> <system.diagnostics> <trace autoflush="false" indentsize="4"> <listeners> <add name="consoleListener" type="System.Diagnostics.ConsoleTraceListener" traceOutputOptions="ProcessId, DateTime" /> </listeners> </trace> </system.diagnostics> </configuration> ```
For details about adding trace listeners to the application configuration file, see [\<listeners\>](../Topic/%3Clisteners%3E%20Element%20for%20%3Ctrace%3E.md).
The TraceOptions enumeration is not used by the following classes and methods:
- The <xref:System.Diagnostics.EventLogTraceListener> class, because it can cause a large volume of data to be written to the log.
- The `Write` and `WriteLine` methods of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.ConsoleTraceListener>, <xref:System.Diagnostics.DefaultTraceListener>, and <xref:System.Diagnostics.TextWriterTraceListener> classes.
- The <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceListener.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceListener.WriteLine%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceListener> class when they are not overridden in a derived class.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the TraceOptions enumeration to programmatically set the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceListener.TraceOutputOptions%2A> property for a console trace listener. The console trace listener is one of the listeners enumerated in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource.Listeners%2A> property of a trace source. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
[!code-cs[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#16](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#16](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions Callstack = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Write the call stack, which is represented by the return value of the <xref:System.Environment.StackTrace%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions DateTime = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions LogicalOperationStack = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Write the logical operation stack, which is represented by the return value of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager.LogicalOperationStack%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions ProcessId = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Write the process identity, which is represented by the return value of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Process.Id%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions ThreadId = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Write the thread identity, which is represented by the return value of the <xref:System.Threading.Thread.ManagedThreadId%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property for the current thread.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.TraceOptions Timestamp = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Write the timestamp, which is represented by the return value of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.GetTimestamp%2A> method.
